articles: Ready or not, enterprises are betting on AI | TechCrunch
summaries: Major enterprise AI deals were announced this week, including partnerships between Anthropic-IBM and Anthropic-Deloitte, while Zendesk unveiled AI agents for customer service automation, though Deloitte faced criticism for AI-generated errors in a government report.

rawData.title: Apple ends support for Clips video-editing app
rawData.summary: Apple is discontinuing its Clips video editing app, removing it from the App Store on October 10th, 2025, though existing users can continue using the app on iOS and iPadOS without future updates.

rawData.title: Ready or not, enterprises are betting on AI | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Major enterprise AI deals were announced this week, including partnerships between Anthropic-IBM and Anthropic-Deloitte, while Zendesk unveiled AI agents for customer service automation, though Deloitte faced criticism for AI-generated errors in a government report.

rawData.title: How Verge readers, and writers, are managing our kids’ screen time
rawData.summary: A survey by Pew Research shows diverse approaches to managing children's screen time, with parents focusing more on content control and intentional usage than strict time limits, while 86% report having screen rules even if not strictly enforced.

rawData.title: The AirPods 4 and Lego’s brick-ified Grogu are our favorite deals this week
rawData.summary: Apple's base AirPods 4 are at their lowest price of $89 ($40 off), while Lego's 1,048-piece Star Wars Grogu set is discounted to $70, both available at major retailers alongside deals on Philips Hue bulbs and Sonos speakers.

rawData.title: It's not too late for Apple to get AI right | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Despite OpenAI's new ChatGPT app platform launch, Apple could still dominate AI-powered app interactions through an improved Siri and its extensive ecosystem of 1.5 billion iPhone users, though its AI efforts remain delayed.

rawData.title: American politics has devolved into shitposting and aura farming
rawData.summary: The article analyzes how political discourse in America has evolved into two main modes: 'aura farming' (attempts to look cool through posturing) and 'shitposting' (intentionally incoherent humor), exemplified by incidents like the viral Portland Frog protestor confronting federal agents.

rawData.title: Dreams of Another feels like a fever dream
rawData.summary: Dreams of Another is a surreal third-person exploration game where players use a gun that creates rather than destroys, navigating through dreamlike vignettes filled with strange conversations and deconstructed landscapes that can suddenly materialize into objects and characters.

rawData.title: Is the Coros Nomad really an adventure watch?
rawData.summary: A detailed review of the Coros Nomad adventure watch ($349) on the Tahoe Rim Trail finds it's a good watch at a competitive price point, but lacks specialized features for serious hikers and trail runners while being more oriented toward road runners.

rawData.title: Gear News of the Week: Intel’s New Chips Arrive, and Apple May Debut iPads and MacBooks This Month
rawData.summary: Intel announced its next-gen Core Ultra Series 3 (Panther Lake) CPUs, promising 50% faster performance and improved efficiency to compete with Qualcomm and Apple, with initial shipments starting by year-end and broader availability in January 2026.
